Description: Bluetongue is a viral disease that affects ruminants, including sheep and cattle. It is transmitted by biting midges and can cause fever, swelling, and bluish discoloration of the tongue.

Bovine spongiform encephalopathy, also known as mad cow disease, is a neurodegenerative disease in cattle. It is caused by misfolded proteins called prions and can lead to progressive neurological symptoms.
Infectious haematopoietic necrosis is a viral disease that affects salmonid fish, such as trout and salmon. It can cause anemia, hemorrhage, and mortality in affected fish populations.

Scrapie is a transmissible spongiform encephalopathy that affects sheep and goats. It is characterized by prion accumulation in the central nervous system, leading to neurodegeneration and behavioral changes.

Disease: Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza in Wild Birds
Description: Highly pathogenic avian influenza is a viral disease that primarily affects birds, including wild bird populations. It can cause severe respiratory illness, high mortality rates, and has the potential for zoonotic transmission.

Disease: Low Pathogenic Avian Influenza in Wild Birds
Description: Low pathogenic avian influenza is a milder form of avian influenza that primarily affects birds, including wild bird populations. It can cause mild respiratory illness and may lead to the emergence of highly pathogenic strains.

Disease: Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza in Poultry
Description: Highly pathogenic avian influenza is a viral disease that affects poultry, including chickens and turkeys. It can cause severe respiratory illness, high mortality rates, and has the potential for zoonotic transmission.

Disease: Low Pathogenic Avian Influenza in Poultry
Description: Low pathogenic avian influenza is a milder form of avian influenza that affects poultry, including chickens and turkeys. It can cause mild respiratory illness and may lead to the emergence of highly pathogenic strains.
Newcastle disease is a viral disease that affects poultry and wild birds. It can cause respiratory and neurological symptoms and can have significant economic impacts on the poultry industry.
Bonamia exitiosa is a protozoan parasite that infects oysters. It can cause mortality in affected oyster populations and has implications for oyster farming and fisheries.
West Nile fever is a viral disease primarily transmitted by mosquitoes. It can affect humans, birds, and other animals, causing flu-like symptoms and, in severe cases, neurological complications.
Koi herpesvirus disease is a viral infection that affects koi and common carp. It can cause significant mortality in affected fish populations and is a concern for the aquaculture industry.

Brucella melitensis is a bacterial species that causes brucellosis in small ruminants, such as sheep and goats. It can also infect humans, causing flu-like symptoms and potential long-term complications.
Marteilia refringens is a parasitic protozoan that infects mollusks, such as oysters. It can cause mortality in affected oyster populations and has implications for shellfish farming and fisheries.
Rabies is a viral disease that affects mammals, including humans. It is transmitted through the bite of an infected animal and can cause neurological symptoms, leading to death if left untreated.
Bonamia ostreae is a protozoan parasite that infects oysters. It can cause mortality in affected oyster populations and has implications for oyster farming and fisheries.
Aujeszky's disease, also known as pseudorabies, is a viral disease that primarily affects pigs. It can also infect other animals, causing respiratory and neurological symptoms.
Equine infectious anaemia is a viral disease that affects horses and other equines. It can cause anemia, fever, and a range of clinical signs, and is of significant concern for the equine industry.
Brucella abortus is a bacterial species that causes brucellosis in cattle. It can also infect other animals and humans, causing flu-like symptoms and potential long-term complications.
Anthrax is a bacterial disease that affects both animals and humans. It can cause severe illness and death and is primarily transmitted through contact with contaminated animal products or spores.
Brucella suis is a bacterial species that causes brucellosis in pigs. It can also infect other animals and humans, causing flu-like symptoms and potential long-term complications.
Epizootic haemorrhagic disease is a viral disease that primarily affects deer and other ruminants. It can cause fever, hemorrhage, and high mortality rates in affected populations.

Disease: Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza in Captive Poultry
Description: Highly pathogenic avian influenza is a viral disease that affects captive poultry, including chickens and turkeys. It can cause severe respiratory illness, high mortality rates, and has the potential for zoonotic transmission.
Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex refers to a group of bacteria that cause tuberculosis in various species, including humans and animals.
Sheep pox and goat pox are viral diseases that affect sheep and goats, respectively. They can cause fever, skin lesions, and significant economic losses in affected livestock populations.
